perturbation.original_text:
Sponsor shall pay the following non-accrued obligation quarterly
fees on or prior to the following dates:
                                                    
            June 30, 1999                              [*]
            September 30, 1999                         [*]
            December 31, 1999                          [*]
            March 31, 2000                             [*]
            June 30, 2000                              [*]
            September 30, 2000                         [*]
            December 31, 2000                          [*]
perturbation.changed_text:
Sponsor shall pay the following non-accrued obligation quarterly
fees according to the following schedule. Payments are due within 30 days of the end of each quarter:
                                                    
            June 30, 1999                              [*]
            September 30, 1999                         [*]
            December 31, 1999                          [*]
            March 31, 2000                             [*]
            June 30, 2000                              [*]
            September 30, 2000                         [*]
            December 31, 2000                          [*]
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that quarterly fees must be paid 'on or prior to' the dates listed. The modified text changes this to say that payments are due 'within 30 days of the end of each quarter'. This creates a contradiction because the original implied payment was due *on* those dates, while the new text creates a window for payment up to 30 days later.

perturbation.original_text:
4.1   TERM. The Term shall commence on the date of this Agreement and, unless earlier terminated or extended as provided below, shall end as of
December 31, 2000.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1   TERM. The Term shall commence on the date of this Agreement and, unless earlier terminated or extended as provided below, shall automatically renew on December 31, 2000, for an additional year, unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 30 days prior to the renewal date.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that the term ends on December 31, 2000. The changed text introduces an automatic renewal clause, contradicting the fixed end date and creating uncertainty about the actual term of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1   CONFIDENTIALITY. During the Term, and for a period of five (5) years thereafter, the receiving party will not disclose to others or use for any
purpose of its own, other than in performance of this Agreement, any
Confidential Information of the other party.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1   CONFIDENTIALITY. During the Term, and for a period of one (1) year thereafter, the receiving party will not disclose to others or use for any
purpose of its own, other than in performance of this Agreement, any
Confidential Information of the other party.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states the confidentiality period extends for five years after the term. The modified clause reduces this period to one year, creating a contradiction regarding the duration of confidentiality obligations. This could lead to disputes about whether certain information disclosed after one year but before five years is protected or not.
